ambassador-houda-nonoo-legacy.name: Houda Nonoo
ambassador-houda-nonoo-legacy.bio: Served as Bahrain's Ambassador to the United States from 2008 to 2013, the first Jewish ambassador appointed by any Arab country.

ambassador-houda-nonoo-legacy.name: Nancy Khedouri
ambassador-houda-nonoo-legacy.bio: Bahraini Jewish politician who served on the Shura Council, Bahrain's appointed upper house of parliament, advocating for interfaith dialogue.

ambassador-houda-nonoo-legacy.name: Ebrahim Nonoo
ambassador-houda-nonoo-legacy.bio: Bahraini Jewish businessman and head of the Jewish community of Bahrain, working to preserve Jewish heritage in the Gulf.

jewish-community-of-bahrain.name: Ebrahim Nonoo
jewish-community-of-bahrain.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Bahrain who maintains Jewish communal life and promotes interfaith relations in the kingdom.

jewish-community-of-bahrain.name: Houda Nonoo
jewish-community-of-bahrain.bio: Bahrain's Ambassador to the United States (2008–2013) and the most internationally prominent member of the Bahraini Jewish community.

jewish-community-of-bahrain.name: Nancy Khedouri
jewish-community-of-bahrain.bio: Member of Bahrain's Shura Council and one of the few Jewish parliamentarians in the Arab world.

house-of-ten-commandments.name: Houda Nonoo
house-of-ten-commandments.bio: Bahrain's first Jewish ambassador whose international profile brought attention to Jewish heritage sites in the kingdom.

house-of-ten-commandments.name: Nancy Khedouri
house-of-ten-commandments.bio: Bahraini Jewish politician who supported the preservation and recognition of Bahrain's Jewish heritage landmarks.

house-of-ten-commandments.name: Ebrahim Nonoo
house-of-ten-commandments.bio: Leader of the Bahraini Jewish community who oversees the preservation of Jewish heritage sites in Bahrain.

instituto-hebreo-dr-chaim-weizmann.name: Gabriel Zaliasnik
instituto-hebreo-dr-chaim-weizmann.bio: Prominent Chilean Jewish lawyer who served as president of the Comunidad Judía de Chile and is active in Jewish education initiatives.

instituto-hebreo-dr-chaim-weizmann.name: Claudio Grossman
instituto-hebreo-dr-chaim-weizmann.bio: Chilean-Jewish legal scholar who served as dean of American University Washington College of Law, a prominent figure in Chile's Jewish intellectual community.

instituto-hebreo-dr-chaim-weizmann.name: Ángel Faivovich
instituto-hebreo-dr-chaim-weizmann.bio: Chilean senator of Jewish descent (1900–1992) who was a major political figure and supporter of Jewish communal institutions in Chile.

comunidad-jud-a-de-chile.name: Gerardo Gorodischer
comunidad-jud-a-de-chile.bio: Chilean Jewish communal leader active in the organizational life of the Comunidad Judía de Chile.

comunidad-jud-a-de-chile.name: Gabriel Zaliasnik
comunidad-jud-a-de-chile.bio: Lawyer and former president of the Comunidad Judía de Chile who has represented Chilean Jewish interests nationally and internationally.

comunidad-jud-a-de-chile.name: Claudio Grossman
comunidad-jud-a-de-chile.bio: Chilean-Jewish international law expert and former dean of American University Washington College of Law, a leading figure in Chile's Jewish community.

comunidad-judia-de-chile.name: Gabriel Zaliasnik
comunidad-judia-de-chile.bio: Attorney and former president of the Comunidad Judía de Chile who has been a leading voice on Jewish affairs in Latin America.

comunidad-judia-de-chile.name: Gerardo Gorodischer
comunidad-judia-de-chile.bio: Active member of the Chilean Jewish community leadership contributing to organizational and cultural life.

comunidad-judia-de-chile.name: Ángel Faivovich
comunidad-judia-de-chile.bio: Chilean politician of Jewish descent who served in the Senate and was a prominent supporter of the Chilean Jewish community.

colegio-colombo-hebreo.name: Salomón Hakim
colegio-colombo-hebreo.bio: Colombian neurosurgeon of Jewish descent (1922–2011) who invented the Hakim valve for treating hydrocephalus, one of Colombia's most celebrated scientists.

colegio-colombo-hebreo.name: Jaime Gilinski
colegio-colombo-hebreo.bio: Colombian Jewish billionaire banker and one of Latin America's wealthiest business leaders, a major supporter of Jewish communal institutions in Colombia.

colegio-colombo-hebreo.name: Isaac Lee
colegio-colombo-hebreo.bio: Colombian Jewish media executive who served as chief content officer at Univision and head of Fusion, a prominent figure in Colombian Jewish life.

confederacion-comunidades-judias-colombi.name: Jaime Gilinski
confederacion-comunidades-judias-colombi.bio: Colombian Jewish billionaire banker whose family has been deeply involved in supporting Colombia's Jewish communal organizations and institutions.

confederacion-comunidades-judias-colombi.name: Salomón Hakim
confederacion-comunidades-judias-colombi.bio: World-renowned Colombian Jewish neurosurgeon (1922–2011) whose innovation of the Hakim valve saved countless lives.

confederacion-comunidades-judias-colombi.name: Isaac Lee
confederacion-comunidades-judias-colombi.bio: Colombian Jewish media executive and former head of news at Univision, prominent in Colombia's Jewish community.

central-council-of-jewish-communities-in.name: Yaron Nadbornik
central-council-of-jewish-communities-in.bio: Chairman of the Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland, leading the organizational framework for Finnish Jewry.

central-council-of-jewish-communities-in.name: Ben Zyskowicz
central-council-of-jewish-communities-in.bio: Longest-serving member of the Finnish Parliament (National Coalition Party) and Finland's most prominent Jewish public figure.

central-council-of-jewish-communities-in.name: Max Jakobson
central-council-of-jewish-communities-in.bio: Finnish Jewish diplomat and journalist (1923–2013) who was a candidate for UN Secretary-General in 1971, the most internationally renowned Finnish Jew.

jewish-community-helsinki.name: Yaron Nadbornik
jewish-community-helsinki.bio: Chairman of the Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland and leader of Helsinki's Jewish communal life.

jewish-community-helsinki.name: Ben Zyskowicz
jewish-community-helsinki.bio: Finnish Jewish politician and the longest-serving member of Finland's parliament, a prominent voice for the Helsinki Jewish community.

jewish-community-helsinki.name: Max Jakobson
jewish-community-helsinki.bio: Prominent Finnish Jewish diplomat (1923–2013) who nearly became UN Secretary-General and was a distinguished member of the Helsinki Jewish community.

helsingin-juutalainen-seurakunta.name: Yaron Nadbornik
helsingin-juutalainen-seurakunta.bio: Leading figure of the Helsinki Jewish congregation who chairs the Central Council of Jewish Communities in Finland.

helsingin-juutalainen-seurakunta.name: Ben Zyskowicz
helsingin-juutalainen-seurakunta.bio: Longest-serving Finnish parliamentarian of Jewish descent, a visible representative of Helsinki's Jewish congregation in public life.

helsingin-juutalainen-seurakunta.name: Max Jakobson
helsingin-juutalainen-seurakunta.bio: Finnish Jewish diplomat and author (1923–2013) who was a member of the Helsinki Jewish community and candidate for UN Secretary-General.

helsinki-synagogue.name: Yaron Nadbornik
helsinki-synagogue.bio: Head of the Finnish Jewish community who oversees the historic Helsinki Synagogue, built in 1906 and Finland's main Jewish house of worship.

helsinki-synagogue.name: Ben Zyskowicz
helsinki-synagogue.bio: Finland's most recognized Jewish public figure and longtime member of parliament, associated with the Helsinki Synagogue.

helsinki-synagogue.name: Max Jakobson
helsinki-synagogue.bio: Renowned Finnish Jewish diplomat (1923–2013) and congregant of the Helsinki Synagogue community.

jewish-community-centre-hong-kong.name: Michael Kadoorie
jewish-community-centre-hong-kong.bio: Chairman of CLP Holdings and The Hongkong and Shanghai Hotels, leading figure of Hong Kong's Jewish community and major philanthropist.

jewish-community-centre-hong-kong.name: Solomon Bard
jewish-community-centre-hong-kong.bio: Hong Kong Jewish physician and historian (1916–2016) who authored works on the history of Hong Kong's Jewish community and served it for decades.

jewish-community-centre-hong-kong.name: Lawrence Kadoorie
jewish-community-centre-hong-kong.bio: Lord Kadoorie (1899–1993), major Hong Kong industrialist and philanthropist who was central to the Jewish community and supported numerous charitable causes.

jewish-historical-society-of-hong-kong.name: Dennis Leventhal
jewish-historical-society-of-hong-kong.bio: Leader of the Jewish Historical Society of Hong Kong who has documented and preserved the history of Jews in Hong Kong and the Far East.

jewish-historical-society-of-hong-kong.name: Solomon Bard
jewish-historical-society-of-hong-kong.bio: Physician and historian (1916–2016) who authored seminal works on Hong Kong's Jewish merchants and served the community for over seven decades.

jewish-historical-society-of-hong-kong.name: Michael Kadoorie
jewish-historical-society-of-hong-kong.bio: Billionaire chairman of CLP Holdings whose Kadoorie family is among the most historically significant Jewish families in Hong Kong.

kadoorie-family-enterprises.name: Michael Kadoorie
kadoorie-family-enterprises.bio: Chairman of CLP Holdings and The Hongkong and Shanghai Hotels, continuing the Kadoorie dynasty as one of Asia's most prominent business leaders.

kadoorie-family-enterprises.name: Lawrence Kadoorie
kadoorie-family-enterprises.bio: Lord Kadoorie (1899–1993), transformed CLP into a major utility and was instrumental in developing Hong Kong's power infrastructure.

kadoorie-family-enterprises.name: Elly Kadoorie
kadoorie-family-enterprises.bio: Sir Elly Kadoorie (1867–1944), Baghdadi Jewish patriarch who founded the Kadoorie business empire in Hong Kong and Shanghai.

jewish-representative-council-of-ireland.name: Maurice Cohen
jewish-representative-council-of-ireland.bio: Chairman of the Jewish Representative Council of Ireland, serving as the principal representative body for Irish Jewry.

jewish-representative-council-of-ireland.name: Alan Shatter
jewish-representative-council-of-ireland.bio: Irish Jewish politician who served as Minister for Justice and Equality (2011–2014), the most prominent Jewish political figure in modern Ireland.

jewish-representative-council-of-ireland.name: Gerald Goldberg
jewish-representative-council-of-ireland.bio: First Jewish Lord Mayor of Cork (1977) and a distinguished lawyer who championed civil liberties and interfaith relations in Ireland.

irish-jewish-museum-dublin.name: Chaim Herzog
irish-jewish-museum-dublin.bio: President of Israel (1983–1993) who grew up in the Dublin building that later became the Irish Jewish Museum; his father Isaac Herzog served as Chief Rabbi of Ireland.

irish-jewish-museum-dublin.name: Raphael Siev
irish-jewish-museum-dublin.bio: Longtime curator of the Irish Jewish Museum in Dublin who preserved and interpreted the history of Ireland's Jewish community for decades.

irish-jewish-museum-dublin.name: Robert Briscoe
irish-jewish-museum-dublin.bio: First Jewish Lord Mayor of Dublin (1956–1957, 1961–1962) and a veteran of the Irish War of Independence, a central figure in Irish Jewish history.

colegio-le-n-pinelo.name: León Trahtemberg
colegio-le-n-pinelo.bio: Prominent Peruvian Jewish educator, columnist, and educational consultant closely associated with Jewish schooling in Lima.

colegio-le-n-pinelo.name: Efraín Goldenberg
colegio-le-n-pinelo.bio: Peruvian statesman of Jewish descent who served as Prime Minister of Peru in 2002, a distinguished figure in Peru's Jewish community.

colegio-le-n-pinelo.name: Baruch Ivcher
colegio-le-n-pinelo.bio: Israeli-Peruvian media mogul and owner of Frecuencia Latina who is a major supporter of Jewish institutions in Peru.

asociacion-judia-del-peru.name: Efraín Goldenberg
asociacion-judia-del-peru.bio: Former Prime Minister of Peru (2002) of Jewish descent, the highest-ranking Peruvian Jewish official in the country's history.

asociacion-judia-del-peru.name: Baruch Ivcher
asociacion-judia-del-peru.bio: Israeli-born Peruvian media magnate who is a leading figure in Peru's Jewish community and a champion of press freedom.

asociacion-judia-del-peru.name: León Trahtemberg
asociacion-judia-del-peru.bio: Peruvian Jewish educator and public intellectual of Romanian-Jewish descent who is one of Peru's most respected voices on education.

eliyahu-hanavi-synagogue.name: André Aciman
eliyahu-hanavi-synagogue.bio: Egyptian-Jewish writer born in Alexandria who authored 'Out of Egypt,' a memoir of his Sephardic Jewish family's life in the city.

eliyahu-hanavi-synagogue.name: Carmen Weinstein
eliyahu-hanavi-synagogue.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Cairo (1940s–2013) who tirelessly maintained Jewish heritage sites in Egypt including historic synagogues.

eliyahu-hanavi-synagogue.name: Magda Haroun
eliyahu-hanavi-synagogue.bio: Current president of the Jewish Community of Egypt who has worked to preserve Egyptian Jewish heritage and synagogues, succeeding Carmen Weinstein.

egyptian-jewish-community-historic.name: Magda Haroun
egyptian-jewish-community-historic.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Egypt, one of the last custodians of a once-thriving community that numbered over 80,000.

egyptian-jewish-community-historic.name: Carmen Weinstein
egyptian-jewish-community-historic.bio: Long-serving president of the Jewish Community of Cairo (d. 2013) who devoted her life to maintaining Egypt's Jewish heritage and cemeteries.

egyptian-jewish-community-historic.name: Haim Nahum
egyptian-jewish-community-historic.bio: Chief Rabbi of Egypt (1925–1960) who led the Jewish community through a turbulent era and represented Egyptian Jewry internationally.

ben-ezra-synagogue-cairo.name: Solomon Schechter
ben-ezra-synagogue-cairo.role: Scholar and Discoverer of the Geniza
ben-ezra-synagogue-cairo.bio: Romanian-British Jewish scholar (1847–1915) who discovered and recovered the Cairo Geniza from the Ben Ezra Synagogue, one of the greatest manuscript finds in history.

ben-ezra-synagogue-cairo.name: Maimonides
ben-ezra-synagogue-cairo.bio: Moses ben Maimon (1138–1204), the preeminent medieval Jewish philosopher and physician who lived in Fustat near the Ben Ezra Synagogue, where his documents were preserved in the Geniza.

ben-ezra-synagogue-cairo.name: Haim Nahum
ben-ezra-synagogue-cairo.bio: Chief Rabbi of Egypt (1925–1960) who oversaw the care of Cairo's historic synagogues including the Ben Ezra during the 20th century.

sha-ar-hashamayim-synagogue.name: Haim Nahum
sha-ar-hashamayim-synagogue.bio: Chief Rabbi of Egypt (1925–1960) who served at Sha'ar Hashamayim and was a learned Sephardic scholar and community leader.

sha-ar-hashamayim-synagogue.name: Yusuf Aslan Cattaui
sha-ar-hashamayim-synagogue.bio: Yusuf Aslan Cattaui Pasha (1861–1942), Egyptian Jewish politician and community leader who served in the Egyptian Senate and supported Jewish institutions in Cairo.

sha-ar-hashamayim-synagogue.name: Carmen Weinstein
sha-ar-hashamayim-synagogue.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Cairo who worked to preserve Sha'ar Hashamayim and other historic synagogues in Egypt.

jewish-community-of-thailand.name: Rabbi Yosef Kantor
jewish-community-of-thailand.bio: Chabad emissary who has served as Chief Rabbi of Thailand since the 1990s, establishing Jewish communal infrastructure for residents and travelers.

jewish-community-of-thailand.name: Rabbi Nehemia Wilhelm
jewish-community-of-thailand.bio: Chabad-Lubavitch emissary co-directing Jewish communal activities in Bangkok, supporting the Jewish community and Israeli travelers in Thailand.

jewish-community-of-thailand.name: Rabbi Dani Efrati
jewish-community-of-thailand.bio: Chabad rabbi in Phuket who became widely known for supporting Israeli and Jewish tourists during the 2004 tsunami relief efforts.

jewish-association-of-thailand.name: Rabbi Yosef Kantor
jewish-association-of-thailand.bio: Chief Rabbi of Thailand and head of Chabad-Lubavitch in the country, serving as spiritual leader for the Jewish Association's community.

jewish-association-of-thailand.name: Rabbi Nehemia Wilhelm
jewish-association-of-thailand.bio: Chabad emissary in Bangkok who works with the Jewish Association of Thailand to serve the expatriate and traveler community.

jewish-association-of-thailand.name: Rabbi Dani Efrati
jewish-association-of-thailand.bio: Chabad emissary in Phuket serving Thailand's southern Jewish community, recognized for his role in the 2004 tsunami response.

temple-emil-manila.name: Frank Ephraim
temple-emil-manila.bio: Jewish refugee who escaped to Manila during the Holocaust and later wrote 'Escape to Manila,' documenting the rescue of over 1,200 Jews by the Philippines.

temple-emil-manila.name: Philip Frieder
temple-emil-manila.bio: American Jewish businessman and president of the Manila Jewish community who, along with his brothers, helped organize the rescue of Jewish refugees to the Philippines during WWII.

temple-emil-manila.name: Alex Frieder
temple-emil-manila.bio: One of the Frieder brothers from Cincinnati who used their cigar business connections in Manila to help rescue Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi Europe.

comunidad-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Mauricio Rosencof
comunidad-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Uruguayan Jewish playwright and author (born 1933) of Polish-Jewish descent, one of Uruguay's most important literary figures and a former political prisoner.

comunidad-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Jacobo Langsner
comunidad-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Romanian-born Uruguayan Jewish playwright (1927–2014) who became one of the most acclaimed dramatists in Uruguayan theater.

comunidad-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Ricardo Lackner
comunidad-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Leader of the organized Jewish community in Uruguay, active in coordinating communal affairs and representing Uruguayan Jewry.

comit-central-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Ricardo Lackner
comit-central-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: President of the Comité Central Israelita del Uruguay, the umbrella organization representing Uruguay's Jewish community.

comit-central-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Mauricio Rosencof
comit-central-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Acclaimed Uruguayan Jewish writer and playwright whose works explore themes of identity, imprisonment, and resilience.

comit-central-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Jacobo Langsner
comit-central-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Celebrated Uruguayan Jewish dramatist (1927–2014) whose plays were staged throughout Latin America.

comite-central-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Mauricio Rosencof
comite-central-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Uruguayan Jewish author and playwright of Polish-Jewish descent, best known for his memoir 'The Letters That Never Came' about his family's Holocaust experience.

comite-central-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Jacobo Langsner
comite-central-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Major Uruguayan Jewish playwright (1927–2014) who contributed significantly to Latin American theater.

comite-central-israelita-del-uruguay.name: Ricardo Lackner
comite-central-israelita-del-uruguay.bio: Head of the Comité Central Israelita, Uruguay's central Jewish representative organization.

auckland-hebrew-congregation.name: Joel Goldberg
auckland-hebrew-congregation.bio: President of the Auckland Hebrew Congregation, the largest Jewish community in New Zealand dating back to the 1840s.

auckland-hebrew-congregation.name: Julius Vogel
auckland-hebrew-congregation.bio: Sir Julius Vogel (1835–1899), Jewish Prime Minister of New Zealand (1873–1876) who was instrumental in the colony's development and economic policy.

auckland-hebrew-congregation.name: David Zwartz
auckland-hebrew-congregation.bio: Distinguished New Zealand Jewish community leader who served for decades as a respected voice on interfaith relations and Jewish affairs.

wellington-hebrew-congregation.name: David Zwartz
wellington-hebrew-congregation.bio: Prominent member of the Wellington Hebrew Congregation and a respected commentator on Jewish affairs and interfaith relations in New Zealand.

wellington-hebrew-congregation.name: Julius Vogel
wellington-hebrew-congregation.bio: New Zealand's only Jewish Prime Minister (1835–1899) who lived in Wellington and shaped the country's infrastructure and immigration policies.

wellington-hebrew-congregation.name: Juliet Moses
wellington-hebrew-congregation.bio: Prominent New Zealand Jewish advocate and spokesperson who has represented New Zealand Jewry on national and international platforms.

new-zealand-jewish-council.name: Juliet Moses
new-zealand-jewish-council.bio: Leading spokesperson of the New Zealand Jewish Council who advocates for the community on issues of antisemitism, Israel, and interfaith dialogue.

new-zealand-jewish-council.name: Julius Vogel
new-zealand-jewish-council.bio: New Zealand's Jewish Prime Minister (1835–1899), a foundational figure in the country's Jewish heritage.

new-zealand-jewish-council.name: David Zwartz
new-zealand-jewish-council.bio: Senior New Zealand Jewish community leader who contributed to national Jewish advocacy and interfaith relations for decades.

jewish-community-of-belgrade.name: Ruben Fuks
jewish-community-of-belgrade.bio: Longtime president of the Federation of Jewish Communities in Serbia who led the post-Yugoslav Jewish communal revival until his death in 2015.

jewish-community-of-belgrade.name: David Albahari
jewish-community-of-belgrade.bio: Serbian Jewish novelist (born 1948) known for works exploring Jewish identity and the Holocaust in the Balkans, one of Serbia's most translated authors.

jewish-community-of-belgrade.name: Aca Singer
jewish-community-of-belgrade.bio: Serbian Jewish Holocaust survivor who served as president of the Federation of Jewish Communities and worked to preserve Holocaust memory in Serbia.

federation-of-jewish-communities-in-serb.name: Robert Sabadoš
federation-of-jewish-communities-in-serb.bio: Leader of the Federation of Jewish Communities in Serbia who oversees Jewish communal life across the country.

federation-of-jewish-communities-in-serb.name: Ruben Fuks
federation-of-jewish-communities-in-serb.bio: Long-serving president of the Federation (d. 2015) who revitalized Serbian Jewish community life after the dissolution of Yugoslavia.

federation-of-jewish-communities-in-serb.name: David Albahari
federation-of-jewish-communities-in-serb.bio: Acclaimed Serbian Jewish writer whose novels and stories explore themes of Jewish life, displacement, and identity in the Balkans.

jewish-community-belgrade.name: Robert Singer
jewish-community-belgrade.bio: Serbian-born Jewish leader associated with the Federation of Jewish Communities of Serbia and international Jewish organizations.

jewish-community-belgrade.name: Ruben Fuks
jewish-community-belgrade.bio: President of the Federation of Jewish Communities in Serbia who was central to reviving Jewish communal institutions after the 1990s conflicts.

jewish-community-belgrade.name: David Albahari
jewish-community-belgrade.bio: Serbian Jewish author whose literary works have brought international attention to the Jewish experience in the former Yugoslavia.

jewish-community-of-bulgaria.name: Elias Canetti
jewish-community-of-bulgaria.bio: Sephardic Jewish writer (1905–1994) born in Ruse, Bulgaria, awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1981 for his works of lasting significance.

jewish-community-of-bulgaria.name: Solomon Passy
jewish-community-of-bulgaria.bio: Bulgarian politician of Jewish descent who served as Foreign Minister (2001–2005) and founded the Atlantic Club of Bulgaria.

jewish-community-of-bulgaria.name: Jules Pascin
jewish-community-of-bulgaria.bio: Bulgarian-Jewish artist (1885–1930), born Julius Mordecai Pincas in Vidin, who became a leading figure of the École de Paris art movement.

organization-of-the-jews-in-bulgaria.name: Oscar Asenov
organization-of-the-jews-in-bulgaria.bio: Leader of the Organization of the Jews in Bulgaria who represents Bulgarian Jewish communal interests.

organization-of-the-jews-in-bulgaria.name: Elias Canetti
organization-of-the-jews-in-bulgaria.bio: Nobel Prize-winning author (1905–1994) from a Sephardic Jewish family in Ruse, Bulgaria's most famous Jewish literary figure.

organization-of-the-jews-in-bulgaria.name: Solomon Passy
organization-of-the-jews-in-bulgaria.bio: Former Bulgarian Foreign Minister of Jewish descent who has been a vocal advocate for minority rights and Euro-Atlantic integration.

shalom-organization-jews-bulgaria.name: Maxim Behar
shalom-organization-jews-bulgaria.bio: Bulgarian PR executive and president of the Shalom Organization of Jews in Bulgaria, representing the community in public affairs.

shalom-organization-jews-bulgaria.name: Elias Canetti
shalom-organization-jews-bulgaria.bio: Bulgaria's Nobel Prize-winning Jewish author (1905–1994) whose Sephardic heritage in Ruse formed the foundation of his literary legacy.

shalom-organization-jews-bulgaria.name: Solomon Passy
shalom-organization-jews-bulgaria.bio: Bulgarian diplomat and politician of Jewish descent, former Foreign Minister and founder of the Atlantic Club of Bulgaria.

asociaci-n-de-beneficencia-israelita-de-.name: Benno Weiser Varon
asociaci-n-de-beneficencia-israelita-de-.bio: Ecuadorian Jewish diplomat and author (1913–2014) who fled Nazi Europe to Ecuador and later served as a diplomat, writing memoirs of Jewish refugee life in South America.

asociaci-n-de-beneficencia-israelita-de-.name: Olga Fisch
asociaci-n-de-beneficencia-israelita-de-.bio: Hungarian-born Jewish artist (1901–1990) who fled to Ecuador during WWII and became celebrated for her work preserving and promoting indigenous Ecuadorian art and textiles.

asociaci-n-de-beneficencia-israelita-de-.name: Karl Kohn
asociaci-n-de-beneficencia-israelita-de-.bio: Czech-born Jewish architect (1894–1979) who escaped to Ecuador and designed modernist buildings in Quito, significantly shaping the city's architecture.

iraqi-jewish-community-historic.name: Naim Dangoor
iraqi-jewish-community-historic.bio: Sir Naim Dangoor (1914–2015), Iraqi-British Jewish businessman and philanthropist who published 'The Scribe' magazine documenting the heritage of Babylonian Jewry.

iraqi-jewish-community-historic.name: Sassoon Eskell
iraqi-jewish-community-historic.bio: Sir Sassoon Eskell (1860–1932), Iraqi Jewish statesman who served as the first Finance Minister of Iraq and was a member of the constituent assembly.

iraqi-jewish-community-historic.name: Meer Basri
iraqi-jewish-community-historic.bio: Iraqi Jewish author, poet, and community leader (1914–2006) who was one of the last prominent Jewish intellectuals to remain in Baghdad.

babylonian-jewry-heritage-center-israel.name: Mordechai Ben-Porat
babylonian-jewry-heritage-center-israel.bio: Iraqi-born Israeli politician (1923–2016) who founded the Babylonian Jewry Heritage Center in Or Yehuda to preserve the history and culture of Iraqi Jews.

babylonian-jewry-heritage-center-israel.name: Shlomo Hillel
babylonian-jewry-heritage-center-israel.bio: Iraqi-born Israeli politician (1923–2021) who served as Speaker of the Knesset and helped organize the mass immigration of Iraqi Jews to Israel.

babylonian-jewry-heritage-center-israel.name: Naim Dangoor
babylonian-jewry-heritage-center-israel.bio: Philanthropist Sir Naim Dangoor (1914–2015) who supported the Heritage Center and funded projects preserving Babylonian Jewish culture.

iraqi-jewish-heritage.name: Naim Dangoor
iraqi-jewish-heritage.bio: Sir Naim Dangoor (1914–2015), Iraqi-British philanthropist who dedicated his life to documenting and preserving the 2,600-year heritage of Babylonian Jewry.

iraqi-jewish-heritage.name: Sassoon Eskell
iraqi-jewish-heritage.bio: First Finance Minister of Iraq (1860–1932), a Jewish statesman who helped shape the modern Iraqi state.

iraqi-jewish-heritage.name: Shlomo Hillel
iraqi-jewish-heritage.bio: Iraqi-born Israeli politician (1923–2021) who organized underground emigration of Iraqi Jews and later served as Speaker of the Knesset.

musmeah-yeshua-synagogue.name: Moses Samuels
musmeah-yeshua-synagogue.bio: Trustee of Musmeah Yeshua Synagogue in Yangon who served as custodian of Myanmar's Jewish heritage for decades.

musmeah-yeshua-synagogue.name: Sammy Samuels
musmeah-yeshua-synagogue.bio: Son of Moses Samuels and current caretaker of the Musmeah Yeshua Synagogue, one of the last Jews remaining in Myanmar and a guardian of its Jewish heritage.

musmeah-yeshua-synagogue.name: Isaac Sofaer
musmeah-yeshua-synagogue.bio: Baghdadi Jewish merchant in colonial Rangoon whose family built the iconic Sofaer's Building and were prominent benefactors of Myanmar's Jewish community.

taiwan-jewish-community.name: Rabbi Ephraim Einhorn
taiwan-jewish-community.bio: American-Israeli rabbi who served the Taipei Jewish Community Center, leading religious and communal life for Jewish expatriates in Taiwan.

taiwan-jewish-community.name: Shlomi Tabib
taiwan-jewish-community.bio: Active leader in the Taiwan Jewish Community who helps coordinate Jewish communal activities and cultural events in Taipei.

taiwan-jewish-community.name: Les Glassman
taiwan-jewish-community.bio: Longtime president of the Taiwan Jewish Community who helped build communal infrastructure for Jewish expatriates in Taipei.

jewish-community-of-taiwan.name: Shlomi Tabib
jewish-community-of-taiwan.bio: Key figure in the Jewish Community of Taiwan who coordinates Jewish life and events for residents and visitors in Taipei.

jewish-community-of-taiwan.name: Rabbi Ephraim Einhorn
jewish-community-of-taiwan.bio: Rabbi who served the Taiwan Jewish community, providing spiritual leadership at the Taipei Jewish Community Center.

jewish-community-of-taiwan.name: Les Glassman
jewish-community-of-taiwan.bio: Leader of the Jewish community in Taiwan who worked to maintain a vibrant communal life for expatriates and visitors.

tsmc-taiwan-semiconductor-manufacturing-.name: Morris Chang
tsmc-taiwan-semiconductor-manufacturing-.bio: Founder of TSMC (born 1931) who created the dedicated semiconductor foundry model, making TSMC the world's most valuable chipmaker.

tsmc-taiwan-semiconductor-manufacturing-.name: C.C. Wei
tsmc-taiwan-semiconductor-manufacturing-.bio: CEO of TSMC who has led the company's continued dominance in advanced semiconductor manufacturing and global chip production.

tsmc-taiwan-semiconductor-manufacturing-.name: Mark Liu
tsmc-taiwan-semiconductor-manufacturing-.bio: Chairman of TSMC who oversees the company's strategic direction, including its expansion of advanced fabs and pivotal role in global technology supply chains.

jewish-community-of-madagascar.name: Aaron Amoyal
jewish-community-of-madagascar.bio: Leader of the Jewish Community of Madagascar who works to maintain Jewish religious life and communal organization on the island.

jewish-community-of-madagascar.name: Toviana Tolotra
jewish-community-of-madagascar.bio: Malagasy community leader who organizes the community of Jewish descent in Madagascar, seeking formal recognition and connection to global Jewry.

jewish-community-of-madagascar.name: Ashrel
jewish-community-of-madagascar.bio: Spiritual leader of the Malagasy Jewish community working to establish formal Jewish institutions on the island of Madagascar.

community-of-jewish-descent-in-madagasca.name: Toviana Tolotra
community-of-jewish-descent-in-madagasca.bio: Malagasy leader of the Community of Jewish Descent in Madagascar, one of Africa's most unique Jewish communities seeking formal recognition.

community-of-jewish-descent-in-madagasca.name: Aaron Amoyal
community-of-jewish-descent-in-madagasca.bio: Active organizer in Madagascar's Jewish community who assists with communal life and connections to international Jewish organizations.

community-of-jewish-descent-in-madagasca.name: Ashrel
community-of-jewish-descent-in-madagasca.bio: Spiritual leader of Madagascar's Jewish community working to build Jewish institutions and formal communal structures.

jewish-community-madagascar.name: Ashrel
jewish-community-madagascar.bio: Spiritual leader of the Communauté Juive de Madagascar who works to establish formal Jewish institutions on the island.

jewish-community-madagascar.name: Toviana Tolotra
jewish-community-madagascar.bio: Key organizer of the Malagasy Jewish community who advocates for recognition and supports Jewish communal development in Madagascar.

jewish-community-madagascar.name: Aaron Amoyal
jewish-community-madagascar.bio: Leader in the Jewish community of Madagascar who maintains religious life and communal organization for Jewish residents.

colegio-instituto-alberto-einstein.name: Aaron Btesh
colegio-instituto-alberto-einstein.bio: Panamanian Jewish community leader and president of the board of Colegio Instituto Alberto Einstein, the Jewish day school serving Panama City's community.

colegio-instituto-alberto-einstein.name: Eric Arturo Delvalle
colegio-instituto-alberto-einstein.bio: President of Panama (1985–1988) of Jewish descent, the most prominent Jewish political figure in Panamanian history and supporter of Jewish institutions.

colegio-instituto-alberto-einstein.name: Max Shalom Delvalle
colegio-instituto-alberto-einstein.bio: First Vice President of Panama (1964–1968) of Jewish descent, uncle of President Eric Delvalle and a pillar of Panama's Jewish community.

kol-shearith-israel.name: Gustavo Kraselnik
kol-shearith-israel.bio: Panamanian Jewish writer and community figure associated with Kol Shearith Israel, contributing to the cultural life of Panama's Jewish community.

kol-shearith-israel.name: Eric Arturo Delvalle
kol-shearith-israel.bio: President of Panama (1985–1988) and member of the Jewish community served by Kol Shearith Israel.

kol-shearith-israel.name: Max Shalom Delvalle
kol-shearith-israel.bio: First Vice President of Panama (1964–1968) from one of the founding Jewish families in Panama, connected to the Kol Shearith Israel community.

patronato-de-la-casa-de-la-comunidad-heb.name: Adela Dworin
patronato-de-la-casa-de-la-comunidad-heb.bio: Longtime president of the Patronato and the Jewish Community of Cuba who kept Jewish life alive on the island through decades of political isolation.

patronato-de-la-casa-de-la-comunidad-heb.name: David Prinstein
patronato-de-la-casa-de-la-comunidad-heb.bio: Vice president of the Cuban Jewish community who has worked alongside Adela Dworin to maintain Jewish communal life and the Patronato synagogue in Havana.

patronato-de-la-casa-de-la-comunidad-heb.name: Ruth Behar
patronato-de-la-casa-de-la-comunidad-heb.bio: Cuban-born Jewish-American anthropologist and author who has written extensively about Cuban Jewish identity and the community's history.

jewish-community-cuba.name: Adela Dworin
jewish-community-cuba.bio: President of the Comunidad Hebrea de Cuba for decades, the most prominent figure in maintaining Jewish life in revolutionary Cuba.

jewish-community-cuba.name: David Prinstein
jewish-community-cuba.bio: Vice president of Cuba's Jewish community who has helped sustain synagogue services, Jewish education, and community events in Havana.

jewish-community-cuba.name: Ruth Behar
jewish-community-cuba.bio: Cuban-American Jewish writer and anthropologist whose works document the experience of Jews in Cuba and the diaspora.

confederaci-n-de-asociaciones-israelitas.name: David Bittan
confederaci-n-de-asociaciones-israelitas.bio: President of CAIV, the umbrella organization representing Venezuela's Jewish communities and coordinating communal affairs.

confederaci-n-de-asociaciones-israelitas.name: Elías Farache
confederaci-n-de-asociaciones-israelitas.bio: Venezuelan Jewish community leader who has served in CAIV's leadership, representing Venezuelan Jewry during a period of significant emigration and political upheaval.

confederaci-n-de-asociaciones-israelitas.name: Abraham Levy Benshimol
confederaci-n-de-asociaciones-israelitas.bio: Venezuelan Jewish architect (1933–2017) who designed significant Sephardic synagogues in Caracas, blending modern architecture with Jewish tradition.

confederacion-asociaciones-israelitas-ve.name: David Bittan
confederacion-asociaciones-israelitas-ve.bio: President of CAIV who leads the federation of Jewish organizations representing Venezuela's once-thriving Jewish community.

confederacion-asociaciones-israelitas-ve.name: Elías Farache
confederacion-asociaciones-israelitas-ve.bio: Senior CAIV leader who has advocated for the Venezuelan Jewish community during years of political crisis and mass emigration.

confederacion-asociaciones-israelitas-ve.name: Abraham Levy Benshimol
confederacion-asociaciones-israelitas-ve.bio: Celebrated Venezuelan Jewish architect (1933–2017) known for designing the Tiferet Israel and Heichal Sephardi synagogues in Caracas.

caiv-venezuela.name: David Bittan
caiv-venezuela.bio: President of CAIV, the central body of Venezuelan Jewish organizations that coordinates communal, educational and religious affairs.

caiv-venezuela.name: Elías Farache
caiv-venezuela.bio: Prominent Venezuelan Jewish leader active in CAIV who works to support the community through political and economic challenges.

caiv-venezuela.name: Abraham Levy Benshimol
caiv-venezuela.bio: Acclaimed Venezuelan Jewish architect (1933–2017) whose synagogue designs are landmarks of Jewish culture in Caracas.

united-congregation-of-israelites.name: Ainsley Henriques
united-congregation-of-israelites.bio: Jamaican Jewish historian and community leader who has documented the 350-year history of Jews in Jamaica and preserves the island's Jewish heritage.

united-congregation-of-israelites.name: Mayer Matalon
united-congregation-of-israelites.bio: Prominent Jamaican Jewish businessman (1931–2016) who led major institutions and was a pillar of Kingston's Jewish community.

united-congregation-of-israelites.name: Marilyn Delevante
united-congregation-of-israelites.bio: Co-author of 'The Island of One People,' a history of the Jews of Jamaica, and an active member of the United Congregation of Israelites.

shaare-shalom-synagogue.name: Ainsley Henriques
shaare-shalom-synagogue.bio: Leading member of the Shaare Shalom Synagogue congregation who has worked to preserve Jamaica's unique Jewish heritage and the historic synagogue.

shaare-shalom-synagogue.name: Mayer Matalon
shaare-shalom-synagogue.bio: Jamaican Jewish civic leader and businessman (1931–2016) who supported Shaare Shalom and the broader Jewish community in Kingston.

shaare-shalom-synagogue.name: Marilyn Delevante
shaare-shalom-synagogue.bio: Jamaican Jewish historian and co-author of the definitive history of Jews in Jamaica, long associated with the Shaare Shalom Synagogue.

mountain-jewish-community-of-azerbaijan.name: Milikh Yevdayev
mountain-jewish-community-of-azerbaijan.bio: Leader of the Mountain Jewish community in Azerbaijan who preserves the cultural heritage and traditions of the Caucasus Mountain Jews.

mountain-jewish-community-of-azerbaijan.name: God Nisanov
mountain-jewish-community-of-azerbaijan.bio: Azerbaijani-Russian billionaire of Mountain Jewish descent (born 1972) who is a major real estate developer and philanthropist supporting Jewish causes.

mountain-jewish-community-of-azerbaijan.name: Zarakh Iliev
mountain-jewish-community-of-azerbaijan.bio: Azerbaijani-Russian billionaire of Mountain Jewish origin (born 1966) who partners with God Nisanov in real estate and supports Mountain Jewish communal life.

mountain-jews-azerbaijan.name: God Nisanov
mountain-jews-azerbaijan.bio: One of the wealthiest Mountain Jews globally (born 1972), Azerbaijani-Russian real estate mogul who funds Jewish communal and cultural projects.

mountain-jews-azerbaijan.name: Zarakh Iliev
mountain-jews-azerbaijan.bio: Azerbaijani-Russian billionaire of Mountain Jewish descent (born 1966), major developer and benefactor of Mountain Jewish heritage preservation.

mountain-jews-azerbaijan.name: Milikh Yevdayev
mountain-jews-azerbaijan.bio: Head of the Mountain Jewish community of Azerbaijan who advocates for the preservation of Juhuri language and Mountain Jewish culture.

nairobi-hebrew-congregation.name: Alexander Wandersman
nairobi-hebrew-congregation.bio: Leader of the Nairobi Hebrew Congregation serving East Africa's small Jewish community.

nairobi-hebrew-congregation.name: Jack Block
nairobi-hebrew-congregation.bio: Kenyan Jewish hotelier (1929–2014) who built the Block Hotels chain (including Serena Hotels) and was a major figure in Kenya's Jewish community.

nairobi-hebrew-congregation.name: Abraham Block
nairobi-hebrew-congregation.bio: Lithuanian Jewish immigrant (1880–1939) who settled in Kenya in 1904, establishing a trading business and helping found the Jewish community in Nairobi.

abayudaya-jewish-community.name: Gershom Sizomu
abayudaya-jewish-community.bio: First Black African rabbi ordained by the Conservative movement and elected member of Uganda's parliament, the spiritual leader of the Abayudaya.

abayudaya-jewish-community.name: Semei Kakungulu
abayudaya-jewish-community.bio: Ugandan military leader and statesman (1869–1928) who adopted Judaism and founded the Abayudaya Jewish community in eastern Uganda around 1919.

abayudaya-jewish-community.name: J.J. Keki
abayudaya-jewish-community.bio: Abayudaya musician and community leader whose Grammy-nominated album 'Abayudaya: Music from the Jewish People of Uganda' brought international attention to the community.

jewish-community-of-zagreb.name: Ognjen Kraus
jewish-community-of-zagreb.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Zagreb and Coordinator of Jewish Communities in Croatia, leading Croatian Jewry's communal and memorial activities.

jewish-community-of-zagreb.name: Slavko Goldstein
jewish-community-of-zagreb.bio: Croatian Jewish writer and publisher (1928–2017) who was a prominent anti-fascist voice and author of works examining Croatia's WWII history.

jewish-community-of-zagreb.name: Ivo Goldstein
jewish-community-of-zagreb.bio: Croatian Jewish historian (born 1958), son of Slavko Goldstein, and professor at the University of Zagreb specializing in Croatian and Jewish history.

el-ghriba-synagogue-djerba.name: Perez Trabelsi
el-ghriba-synagogue-djerba.bio: Head of the Jewish community in Djerba and custodian of the El Ghriba Synagogue, one of the oldest synagogues in the world and a major pilgrimage site.

el-ghriba-synagogue-djerba.name: René Trabelsi
el-ghriba-synagogue-djerba.bio: Tunisian Jewish businessman and son of Perez Trabelsi who served as Tunisia's Minister of Tourism (2018–2020), promoting the El Ghriba pilgrimage internationally.

el-ghriba-synagogue-djerba.name: Roger Bismuth
el-ghriba-synagogue-djerba.bio: President of the Jewish Community of Tunisia who represents Tunisian Jewry and works to preserve North Africa's Jewish heritage.

jewish-community-of-sos-a.name: Luis Hess
jewish-community-of-sos-a.bio: One of the original Jewish refugee settlers in Sosúa who helped build the community and develop its dairy and agricultural industries.

jewish-community-of-sos-a.name: James N. Rosenberg
jewish-community-of-sos-a.bio: American Jewish lawyer and philanthropist (1874–1970) who chaired the Dominican Republic Settlement Association (DORSA), organizing the Jewish refugee colony in Sosúa.

jewish-community-of-sos-a.name: Joseph C. Hyman
jewish-community-of-sos-a.bio: Executive vice-chairman of the American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee who helped coordinate the Sosúa settlement project as a JDC-funded initiative to rescue European Jews.
